meanings.definition: The doctrine that the persons of the Trinity represent three modes or aspects of the divine being, rather than three distinct persons.
meanings.sent1: Some theologians debate the concept of modalism within the Trinity.
meanings.sent2: The church council discussed the implications of modalism on their beliefs.
meanings.sent3: At the theological conference, they joked about the complexities of modalism.
meanings.sent4: Understanding modalism is like seeing the Trinity through different lenses.
meanings.sent5: The students found a creative way to illustrate modalism using simple drawings.

meanings.definition: The belief that there is only one mode or form of existence.
meanings.sent1: Modalism suggests that there is a singular way of being.
meanings.sent2: In philosophy, modalism challenges traditional views on existence.
meanings.sent3: The idea of modalism in nature sparked an interesting debate among scientists.
meanings.sent4: His art reflects a deep understanding of modalism in the universe.
meanings.sent5: The concept of modalism simplifies the complexity of existence for some thinkers.
